sourceDesc.p: TEI-page files converted by Python to TEI-entry file

div.p: SCHELD, a river which riſes on the confines of Picardy, and runs north-eaſt by Cambray, Valenciennes, Tournay, Oudenarde, &c. and receiving the Lis at Ghent, runs eaſt by Dendermond, and then north to Antwerp: below which city it divides into two branches, one called the Weſler-Scheld, which ſeparates Flanders from Zealand, and diſcharges itſelf into the ſea near Fluffing; and the other called the Ofter-Scheld, which runs by Bergen op-zoom, and afterwards between the iſlands Beveland and Schowen, and a little below falls into the ſea.
